alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 6:14AM EST until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until noon EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 611 AM EST, streams continue to rise due to heavy rainfall between Thursday and early this morning. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. The heaviest of the rain was over. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. The stream gauge at Macksburg on Duck Creek was at 12.1 feet and rising, and is likely to reach its bankfull stage of 13 feet around 7 am this morning. Farther down Duck Creek, the gauge at Whipple, at 6.5 feet and rising, may get close to its bankfull stage of 12 feet later this morning. Streams within the warned area should crest by late morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macksburg and Lower Salem. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
